Class ObservableList<T>

java.lang.Object
taskmanagement.application.viewmodel.events.ObservableList<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the element type of the list
public final class ObservableList<T> extends Object
Observable list wrapper for UI binding.

This class does not implement the full List interface. Instead, it manages an internal list and exposes methods for replacing, clearing, and observing changes to the list as a whole. Useful for scenarios such as refreshing a UI table when the list changes.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public List<T> get()
      Returns an immutable snapshot of the current list contents.
      Returns:
      the current immutable list

    • set

      public void set(List<T> items)
      Replaces the entire list with the provided items and notifies listeners.
      Parameters:
      items - the new list contents; if null, the list becomes empty

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the list contents and notifies listeners if it was not already empty.

    • addListener

      public void addListener(ObservableList.Listener<T> l)
      Adds a listener to be notified when the list changes. Duplicate additions are ignored.
      Parameters:
      l - the listener to add (must not be null)

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener(ObservableList.Listener<T> l)
      Removes a listener if present.
      Parameters:
      l - the listener to remove

    • getListeners

      public List<ObservableList.Listener<T>> getListeners()
      Returns an immutable snapshot of the current listeners.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable list of listeners
